lines.text: What do you think I am?! He's a married man!
Of course he is - the good ones always are. Someone has always beaten you to it.
But who wants a husband nobody else wants?

I tell you this is an awfully hard age for a good woman to live in - I mean a woman who wants to have any fun. The old instincts of right and wrong merely hold you back. You're neither one thing nor the other. You're neither happy and bad, nor good and contented. You're just discontentedly decent.
Good, then that'll give me a chance to say something.

[outside on Mary's balcony]
Ooh, my, but it's hot. Will I stick to that chair, Jimmie?
You know better than I do how sticky you are!
